Comment: Honestly, I'd say the issue is that people have had very little faith for almost the whole 21st century and no major political entity was willing to acknowledge and channel that--other than maybe Obama 2008 as a brief window. The end result is that people in despair loops desperate for change who didn't know that much about politics threw a Hail Mary with Trump because they saw Clinton/Biden/Harris were all defenders of the status quo.  >It makes you really wonder, shouldn't we all be outraged by the current state of American politics? I mean, it's just not acceptable anymore...  Honestly, I would say the state of American politics hasn't been acceptable at any point in the 21st century. Of course it keeps getting worse and worse as the root issues remain unaddressed and festering. If we get through Trump, I'm genuinely terrified the Dem party won't learn the lesson--they're really good at that--and they'll run yet another status quo establishment pick without a platform in 2028 who'll win off the backlash. If we do that, I'm terrified for what monster will come out of the GOP and likely win in 2032.
Author: Sminahin

Comment: JB says we need to denounce Dump from the soapbox. For those who don’t have a lot of followers, media reach, etc this may seem like meaningless folly, but the other night I had a thought.  Hundreds of millions of angry murmurs can be pretty damn loud, especially to those who are used to indulgent silence.   You CAN protest all day, every day just by not holding your tongue anymore out of fear you may offend a stranger whose politics you don’t know.   Go ahead and say whatcha wanna say, when and where others can hear it. Use snarky nicknames, complain, whatever. If anyone has a problem with it give ‘em the hairy eyeball and keep on keepin’ on. It’s a small thing, but small things add up. Consider it covering fire for those making bigger moves.

Comment: People love to throw around the idea of a general strike, but the reality is that most people are too scared of losing their jobs to actually risk it. You don’t just need anger for a general strike.. you need collective fearlessness.. and that’s in short supply when everyone’s worrying about how they're going to put food on the table and keep a roof over their kids heads.  The much better call out, and the thing that has a MUCH BETTER chance of actually succeeding: simple sabotage. The OSS (precursor to the CIA) [published a handbook (Project Gutenberg link)](https://www.gutenberg.org/cache/epub/26184/pg26184-images.html) during WW2 with a better alternative that instructs saboteurs on how to ratfuck corporate and government entities.  They knew that mass walkouts were dangerous and easy to crush.. so they taught people how to wreck a system from inside without ever openly revolting. Slow everything down. Follow every rule exactly even when it makes no sense (hell, if you're in a position of authority, *a*dd some of those insane rules). Start endless meetings. Stir up office drama. "Misunderstand" instructions. Lose paperwork. Work just a little bit worse every day.  With strikes, it is really obvious who’s participating, and it makes it easy for bad actors (either within your company, or within the government) to retaliate. But mass simple sabotage? If enough people are doing it, it absolutely grinds everything to a halt.. and on an individual level, it’s almost impossible to prove. You can’t fire half the workforce for “being inefficient” without burning down your own company.  It’s not loud, it’s not heroic, but it’s way more effective in a society where most people can’t afford to gamble everything. Death by a thousand paper cuts still kills.

Comment: > To anyone that will listen  I think it is more important to raise your voice to the people who will **not** listen.  To the point where they are unable to have a moment of peace or rest.  The mistake that has been made in recent protest movements was yelling at the people that agreed with us who were doing everything that they had the power to do.  Because all that did was undermine the work that they were doing and empowering the people who worked against us.  What we must do is disrupt the peace and serenity of those who are our enemies.  We must inject misery and suffering into the lives of those who seek to visit the same on us.  They must know not a moment of calm while they are in public.  While they are trying to eat there must be people screaming at them.  While they walk down the street people should be getting in their face to tell them that they are monsters.  While they try to enjoy time with their significant others and children there should be people telling their family how terrible they are.
